paper.title: The NYU system for MUC-6 or where's the syntax?
paper.venue: MUC6 '95 Proceedings of the 6th conference on Message understanding
paper.abstract: Over the past five MUCs, New York University has clung faithfully to the idea that information extraction should begin with a phase of full syntactic analysis, followed by a semantic analysis of the syntactic structure. Because we have a good, broad-coverage English grammar and a moderately effective method for recovering from parse failures, this approach held us in fairly good stead.
